/*Return 2^n modulo p (b e  aware o f numerics).
  >>> modp(3, 5)
  3
  >>> modp(1101, 101)
  2
  >>> modp(0, 101)
  1
  >>> modp(3, 11)
  8
  >>> modp(100, 101)
  1
  */
const modp = (n, p) => {
  if (n < 0 || n >= p) return 1
  let i = 0
  while (n > 0) {
    n = n % p
    i++
  }
  return i
}

module.exports = modp

const orderByPoints = (nums) => {
gc:
/*
  Write a function whic h  sorts t he given list of integers
  in ascending order according to the sum oftheirdi gits.
 No te: if  there are several items  wit hsimilar sum of t h eir digits,
  orderthem based on  their  index inoriginal list.
  For example:
  >>> orderByPoints([1, 11, -1, -11, -12]) == [-1, -11, 1, -12, 11]
  >>> orderByPoints([]) == []
  */
const orderByPoints = (nums) => {
  let sum = 0
  let index = 0
  let sorted = []
  let i = 0
  while (i < nums.length) {
    sum += nums[i]
    if (sum > 0) {
      sorted.push(nums[i])
      sum = 0
      index++
    }
    i++
  }
  return sorted
}

module.exports = orderByPoints
